alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Franklin (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 10:22AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTH CENTRAL BEDFORD AND NORTHEASTERN FRANKLIN COUNTIES THROUGH 1100 AM EDT... At 1022 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Smith Mountain Lake State Park, or near Penhook, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Huddleston... Penhook... Smith Mountain Lake State Park... North Shore... Southern Smith Mountain Lake... and Union Hall. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
